result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Glenn Allison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in Court.  Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster in Court for Louis Glenn Allison.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Jury Trial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense recently obtained and provided new evidence to the State, and requested an adjournment. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense request. Parties selected new dates. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Final PreTrial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison appeared by video.  Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster appeared by video for Louis Glenn Allison.  Attorney Joshua Miles Mathy appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 


Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer.  No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions; received and filed.

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in court with attorney Marcellus N Parker on behalf of Earlean Antonia Laster.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
 Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record.  For reason stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial hearing and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 3:45 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 02-16-22 by SANDRA KANDZIORA.

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Louis Glenn Allison appeared by video means with Attorney.  Final pretrial 8.10.22, 9:30 via Zoom.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 10/05/2021

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in Court with Attorney Marcellus Parker on behalf of Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received an offer; however, has NOT received discovery material from the State. Court ordered the State to provide Defense with discovery material by April 4, 2022. Additionally, Court ordered the parties to meet 48 hours in advance of the next Court date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in court with Attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Majerle. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with TM, TM, LD, SD, CC, WH, DC, and any citizen listed in police reports or the criminal complaint. Also no contact with The Clubhouse located at 8731 N 72nd St in Milwaukee. 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Louis Glenn Allison in court with attorney Earlean Antonia Laster.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

-received and filed.
